newsitem.title: USA: U.S. condemns shooting in Croatia.
newsitem.headline: U.S. condemns shooting in Croatia.

text.p: The United States on Friday condemned a shooting incident in eastern Croatia in which a Belgian U.N. soldier was killed but said it appears to be the act of a single individual, not a broad threat to peace there.
A Belgian corporal was killed and two other U.N. officials were injured in the shooting incident in the Serb-controlled town of Vukovar in eastern Croatia on Friday, according to the United Nations.
"The United States strongly condemns the attacks today on the United Nations soldiers by a Serbian gunman," State Department spokesman Nicholas Burns said.
"We offer our deepest condolences to the family of the Belgian soldier who was killed in the incident. Two other soldiers were wounded, and we hope for their speedy recovery."
But Burns said the attack "appears to be the act of a single individual" who is now in police custody and under United Nations supervision."

He noted this was the first attack on U.N. forces since they began operations in Eastern Slavonia over a year ago and said U.N. military forces and the regional police under U.N. supervision are working to ensure such incidents are not repeated.

Vukovar is the biggest town in the Serb-held region of Eastern Slavonia which is due to return to Croatian government rule by mid-June. The town was devastated during the Croatian war for independence when Serb forces backed by the Yugoslav army laid siege to Vukovar and pounded it with artillery.
